article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13dKJ2Z hentry entry story-marquee-standard

h2.a: The Life-Extending Red Wine Pill's Surprisingly Early Death

div.p: The strange saga of resveratrol, the wonder drug that never was.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14ayfIK hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: 12 New Paintings From George W. Bush

div.p: This is the art of the 43rd president.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZOW5Ew hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: How To Get Hot, Fresh Fries Each And Every Time

div.p: You know how sometimes you’ll go to McDonald’s and the fries are absolutely amazing, warm and crisp and just the best, best fries you’ve ever had? And other times, they taste like a stale, mushy vat of the Mondays?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Yrw0g8 hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Poor-Quality Chinese Concrete Could Lead To Skyscraper Collapses

div.p: A sand scandal is brewing in China, with concerns that low-quality concrete has been used in the construction of many of the country’s largest buildings — putting them at risk of collapse.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YIbqEv hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Where Pakistani Muslims Go To Secretly Party

div.p: The Kalash people spurn Islamic law by drinking, taking drugs, and partying. So for decades, usually law-abiding Muslims have ventured into their home valleys to party with them.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14axuzc hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: How To Shoot B-Roll That You Can Actually Sell

div.p: Whether you're shooting b-roll specifically to sell or are selling unused footage, there are some things you should know about making money off of this footage.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14crdUd hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: How We Forgot Iraq

div.p: On the first day of the war it became clear that Saddam’s rule was finally going to be pulverized, it seemed wisest to continue ignoring what lay before their eyes.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11lfJct hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The Controversial Science Of Transgender Athletes In Combat Sports

div.p: Can punching someone in the face really be gender neutral?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Y27P8A hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: YOU'LL GET VERTIGO JUST LOOKING AT THESE

h2.a: Russian Daredevil Hangs On From Great Heights

div.p: Russia has proven to have an endless supply of daredevils who get a rush out of climbing sky-scraping towers and monstrous cranes, but one guy who goes by the pseudonym Mustang Wanted tempts gravity by not only scaling his lofty destination but by then hanging off of it.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-15rO0am hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: 3-D Holograms On Your Phone: No Glasses Required

div.p: In theaters, 3-D movies are everywhere. But how about a 3-D holographic movie on your mobile phone?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZfpghF hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: A LOBBYIST BY ANY OTHER NAME

h2.a: How Foreign Governments Make Sure You Don't Know They're Lobbying You

div.p: Countries from Uzbekistan to Ukraine use a loophole to try to quietly influence the U.S. A “foreign agent” by any other name.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WH1KNZ hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: This Lizard-Inspired Robot Can Scamper Across Sand

div.p: Designing a robot that can easily move across loose terrain—say, a rover meant to traverse the surface of Mars—poses a unique engineering challenge: Wheels commonly sink into what engineers call “flowable ground” (mixtures of sand, soil, mud and grass).

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-162K3v5 hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: THE ROAD TO MOZZARELLA IS LINED IN CURDS

h2.a: Adventures in Cheesemaking

div.p: It was Friday, one o’clock in the morning, four hours into my supposedly two-hour homemade mozzarella recipe, and I found myself standing before a pile of cheese more akin to a ball of warm cauliflower than an artisanal dairy product.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14emmSg hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The Wil Wheaton Story That Will Make You Sob In Your Cheerios

div.p: Last night, I was checking Facebook on my phone, when I ran across a story that many of you have may have also seen on your Facebook walls. I’m not sure what compelled me to read it, but five minutes later, my heart may have swollen 3 sizes and there was definitely something in my eye.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZWek9u hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: The Internet-Demanded, Partially Scientific Testing Of Ultra-Ever Dry

div.p: You've seen the amazing YouTube videos, right? Someone tries to wet a surface with water and it amazingly just beads up and runs off. So one reporter had to find out if the stuff really worked.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-149VXF0 hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Yes, Cyberattacks Are Perfectly Legal Under The Laws Of War

div.p: The term "cyberwarfare" is meaningless in the worst way—it puts the imagination into paranoid overdrive and is not limited by any legal definitions. All the rules we’ve got on armed conflict today apply to ye olde bombs and bullets, not viruses and botnets.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZOvLdE hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Cyclist Hits Antelope, Antelope Wins

div.p: This week sees the Cape Epic, a 433-mile trek through western South Africa. During Monday's stage, Austrian Robert Mennen had a close encounter with a stupid, stupid antelope that darted out from the bush.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-102mWN9 hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Is This The Last Big Gay-Marriage Fight?

div.p: Next week, the Supreme Court is expected to issue its decision on the two gay marriage cases in front of it. Either decision could legalize the practice in one quick blow. So a bumper crop of organizations and activists are weighing in now, while there's still a reason to.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZASB9x hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: What Would Life Be Like In A World Without The Internet?

div.p: Not being able to dick off at work all day? Actually talking to friends? Meeting cute strangers on the street in the course of getting directions? NOOOOOOOOOO!

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-102vXWC hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Where's Voyager 1?

div.p: For about three hours on Wednesday, Voyager 1 had left the solar system — before a rewritten news release headline pulled it back in. So where exactly is it?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10nYlVv hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: PETA Euthanized 90% Of The Animals In Its Shelter

div.p: Critics are charging PETA — renowned for its aggressive anti-cruelty campaigns — with hypocrisy after the group's euthanasia statistics were posted on the website of the Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10i3Eps hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: iPads Have Taken Over The Cockpit

div.p: The FAA has finally approved the use of the iPad Electronic Flight Bag. So what's it like to fly with an iPad in the cockpit?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-102oBV6 hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Kids In Vietnam Are Crazy Good At Programming

div.p: 11th graders in Vietnam are so good at programming that they could easily pass an interview at Google.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-102mrTb hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: YOU CAN'T USE YOUR MOM AS A REFERENCE

h2.a: How Background Checks For Guns Really Work

div.p: The Senate and several states are considering measures to require background checks for every firearm purchase. Here's how those checks work.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-149Y9wc hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Pot Industry's Most Politically Important Dispensary

div.p: In the eyes of the federal government, there is no such thing as “medical marijuana.” But there’s a dispensary just blocks from the Capitol.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-15w6xlR hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: How One Man's Makeshift Google Reader Logo Became The 'Default'

div.p: "Five years ago, I was wanting to install Google Reader on my desktop with Fluid but noticed I couldn’t find a good icon for it at all. So I made one, and posted it to Flickr."

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10mO7or hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Inside 'Apple Anonymous': The Secret Society Of Apple’s Retail Army

div.p: Even with strict, Apple Corporate-implemented policies on social media usage of its employees, a portion of Apple retail employees have formed an under-the-radar, “Apple Anonymous” community.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WGmcyp hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: It Turns Out That Great White Sharks Eat Even More Than We Thought

div.p: And we already thought that they ate a lot.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Xqv7RM hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The Weirdest Aircraft Of The 20th Century

div.p: The 20th Century gave us the Wright Brothers, the 747 and the Concorde. But it also gave us some of the strangest things ever to take to the skies. Here are some of the most insane aircraft ever conceived.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-102IFVa hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: BECAUSE THE SUBWAYS ARE SOAKED IN URINE

h2.a: Why I'm Walking Every Single Block In New York City

div.p: The goal of my quest to walk every block of every street in all five boroughs in New York City is to know nothing. To tear down all the generalizations about the city and its people and its neighborhoods that I’ve absorbed without thinking during my time here.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WWMPSb hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: A Surprising Map Of The Countries That Are Most And Least Welcoming To Foreigners

div.p: Buried several hundred pages into a new World Economic Forum report on global tourism, past the sections on air travel infrastructure and physician density (by which they mean the number of physicians per capita, not the mass-per-cubic-meter of individual doctors), are some very interesting numbers.
